result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald James Leifker Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: March 30, 2016

Case called at 11:12 AM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This matter is resolved with a global resolution.
State moves to dismiss but read in for restition purposes Per/Plea Agreement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 1:21 PM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Witt informs the court this matter will be  resolved with a global resolution.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on March 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case  called at 9:24 AM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Continue for status.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference at 03-07-2016 09:00 am

Case called at 2:33 PM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker and Attorney Adam Thomas Witt not in court. Prosecuting Atty Katherine M. Findley appeared for State of Wisconsin.
DA Findley informs the court she has talked with Attorney Witt, and moves to continue this matter.
So ordered.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion
Defendant's Proposed Voir Dire Questions
Defendant's
Jury Worksheet
Defendant's to modify bond

Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called at 10:09 AM.
Attorney Witt's motion for bond modification.
State objects to the modification, for reasons stated on the record.
The court questions Ms. Blum (Ronald's Mother), RE: Ronald's residence.

The Court: Grants modification 
Motions and

Defendant shall have a curfew between 5:00 PM and 8:00 AM, defendant cannot be out of the residence at all.
Defendant shall not be out of the residence between 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM. with out being in  the presence of his mother.
There will be no alcohol or drugs on or at the residence where Mr. Leifker is living.
Defendant shall submit to testing by law enforcement for the presence  drugs or alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall not consume any controlled substance unless the substance is prescribed as medication for the defendant by the defendant's physician.
Defendant shall inform the court with in 48 hours of employment.
Scheduling conference at 01-11-2016 10:00 am
Scheduling conference at 01-04-2016 10:00 am
motion granted
Motion hearing at 11-17-2015 02:00 pm

Telephone scheduling conference at 10-23-2015 10:00 am.
Motion hearing at 11-17-2015 02:00 pm.
Jury trial at 12-04-2015 09:00 am.

Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.   Katherine Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case Called at 9:14 AM.

Attorney Pecora moves for sequestration of witnesses.
State Calls Rick Moyer to the stand
>>Rick Moyer affirmed and testifies.

Direct by DA Findley
Witness identifies the defendant.

Cross by Attorney Pecora

Witness excused at 9:30 AM.

State argues probable cause has been shown.

Attorney Pecora disagrees and request case number 15-CF-65  be dismissed.

The Court Finds:  Probable cause has been shown, and order the defendant be bound over for arraignment.

State files information
Attorney Pecora waives formal reading

Attorney Pecora files demand for discovery and inspection & demand for a speedy trial.

Defendant stands "MUTE"
Court enters a plea of "NOT GUILTY" on behalf of the defendant (all counts)

Motions due by 11/02/2015
Response/Reply due by 11/09/2015.

Telephone Scheduling Conference 10/23/2015.
Motion Hearing 11/17/2015.
Jury trial scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Pecora moves for modification of bond.
DA Findley objects to the modification.

The Court: BOND STANDS

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. 
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not consume or possess any alcohol beverages.
